Basic details: Emily Johnson, a 5-year-old girl, comes to the clinic with her parents, presenting with jaundice.
Vitals:
BP: 90/60 mm Hg
Temp: 99.1°F (37.3°C)
RR: 24/minute
HR: 110/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit quietly on the examination table, appearing slightly lethargic.
Exhibit yellowing of the skin and eyes.
If asked about abdominal pain, mention mild discomfort.
If blood tests are mentioned, ask, "Will it hurt?"
Challenging question: "Why are my eyes and skin yellow? Is it something serious?"
